    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • Operation

        public static void Operation​(boolean is_dynamic)
        Define the basic structure of the calculator, which look like this:
        sen(0) // real number (e, pi, etc...) or mathematical function that return a value. + // arithmetic operation: sum, substraction, division, multiplication. cos(-1) // real number (e, pi, etc...) or mathematical function that return a value. >> 1.0 // result, which in dynamic pre: election must have some value. post: executes the operation-flow for the calculator.
        Parameters:
        is_dynamic - variable must have been declared, and its value must be passed in the arguments when this method is invoked.

      • functionsCalculator

        public static double functionsCalculator​(java.lang.String parser)
        functionsCalculator is encharged of assigning its corrsponding value to the num1 and num2 variables above.
        Which is achieved by parsing the string input and deciding wheter is a plain number or a function. post: num1 and num2 will never have a invalid value since their value always is parsed using this method.
        Parameters:
        parser - must have a value assgined to it; it cannot be null or empty.
        Returns:
        a double number corresponding to the value expressed in parser; if this isn't valid, then returns 0 and notifies it to the user.

      • sliceArray

        public static double[] sliceArray​(double[] array,
                                  double element)
        Slices an double array to the left, i. e. the first element is dropped and another is added at last position
        post: every result in calculator will be added at last position of the memory_results array.
        Parameters:
        array - must be initialized and must have a length assigned.
        element - must be double.
        Returns:
        the same array with the same length, but its last element being the passed in parameter and its oldest one being dropped.

      • parseFraction

        public static double parseFraction​(java.lang.String expression)
        Converts a string that contains a fraction into its double value. E.g. converts "1/2" into 0.5
        Parameters:
        expression - must contain a fraction in it; otherwise it would invoke an error.
        Returns:
        fraction, the numerical equivalent of the fraction string passed.

      • nthRoot

        public static double nthRoot​(int n,
                             double A)
        Calculates the nth-root of a double number.
        Parameters:
        n - must be positive integer number; otherwise it would ran an error.
        A - must be positive real number whenever the index n be even number; otherwise it would invoke an imaginary response.
        Returns:
        the nth-root of Power; if and only if none of these are undefined or unreal numbers.

      • accurate

        public static boolean accurate​(double x0,
                               double x1)

      • log

        public static double log​(double B,
                         double N)
        Calculates the logarithm of base B for a number N, taking advantage of the logarithm's properties.
        Parameters:
        B - must be real positive number; otherwise would not be defined.
        N - must be real positive number; otherwise would not be defined.
        Returns:
        the logarithm of base B for a number N.

      • ln

        public static double ln​(double Power)
        Calculates the natural logarithm for power x by its integral.
        Parameters:
        Power - cannot be negative, otherwise the result would be be undefined.
        Returns:
        Natural logarithm of x.

      • abs

        public static double abs​(double num)
        Calculates the absolute value for number num.
        Parameters:
        num - must be real number.
        Returns:
        absolute value of num.

      • power

        public static double power​(double base,
                           double exponent)
        Caculates the decimal power of decimal base and decimal exponent using the properties of natural logarithms and exponential function.
        Parameters:
        base - must be declared and initialized.
        exponent - must be declared and initialized.
        Returns:
        the n-th power of base n number.

      • e

        public static double e​(double Exponent)
        Calculates an aproximation for the exponential function.
        Parameters:
        Exponent - must be decimal real number.
        Returns:
        euler's number to the exponent-th power.

      • factorial

        public static double factorial​(int num)
        Calculates the factorial of number num using recursion.
        Parameters:
        num - must be positive integer number.
        Returns:
        the factorial for num number.

      • pow

        public static double pow​(double x,
                         int n)
        Calculates the n-th power for base number a.
        Parameters:
        x - must be declared and initalized number.
        n - must be declared and initalized number.
        Returns:
        the n-th power for base number a.

      • sinApprox

        public static double sinApprox​(double x)
        Calculates the approximate value of sinusodial function for number a using Taylor series with periodic accuracy improvement.
        Parameters:
        x - cannot be infinity, must be real number.
        Returns:
        aproximation value of sinusodial function at point a.

      • cosApprox

        public static double cosApprox​(double x)
        Calculates approximation value for cosine function through Taylor Series expansion
        Parameters:
        x - must be real number value.
        Returns:
        approximation (in radians) to the cosine function at point x.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
